column54: Making research or eduational materials open access means that all my collaborators need to agree.  This can be hard, even within ITC, but also with partners from other academic cultures/countries where OA is not the norm and holding on to data/knowledge is part of their way of working/business model.
column66: The comments from the SEP committee on OA challenges to collaboration were very interesting - how do we deal with different ways of working where one partner want to retain ownership of data but we want to make it open?  Some countries still see data/knowledge as something to sell.  I think our policy should contain guidelines to help ITC researchers deal with these situations.  I don't think there is a tailor made solution.

column66: How important is Open Science from a scientific career perspective?

main impediments to open science in my experience are:
1. financial (publishing costs)
2. data being 'scooped' before publication -- requiring data to be quarantined effectively
3. hacking of 'secure' data repositories 
4. students working with permission using non-open data make the closed data available to others without permission who then publish similar articles.
Why does this review not comply to the General Data Protection Regulation of the European Union?  This should be discussed!

column66:
the community that supports open-data-tools has to be stronger.
For example, when using IDL-ENVI / Matlab I do not worry about dependencies which is a pain in python/R.. if I use Octave (which I did) then it crashes between the crash and the crash.... the only software that seems to work, with preservation, is QGIS. It also crashes.
packaging is another issue, with IDL, Matlab or .NET is pretty straightforward.

in my carrier, i programmed, professionally, with Fortran, C++, VB.NET, Matlab, IDL, Python and R, the last two were when I decided to move open. i extensively used ESRI_Arc gis and QGIS, also the last one is when I decided to move open. to be honest, now i spend more time on the gritty things than with commercial software, but maybe this is because i am getting old;-)

Open data is a great idea, and i used it many times... i have to get open education digested, and this is the biggest issue of them all.
